results.title: Sperm cell development in the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This film is chiefly interesting as an example of the use of film in the service of science, in this case, microcinematography. Living cells are shown developing by the use of phase contrast microscopy, a method due to Zernicke, which gives increased contrast by optical means, and without staining.

results.title: Speed scene: the problem of amphetamine abuse
results.brief_description: Presents evidence against the use of amphetamines in any form other than for medical purposes. Discusses psychological dependency on these drugs and how it often leads to other more dangerous, addictive drugs. Notes the most malignant form of amphetamine, one type of which is called “Speed”.

results.title: Special delivery
results.brief_description: Features the varied birth experiences of three first-time couples, focusing on the first stage of labour. The couples are interviewed prior to, and after, birth to see how reality matched their expectations and how the skills acquired helped them cope.

results.title: Speaking effectively...to one or one thousand
results.creator_credit: Bert Decker, Sunset Films and Toastmasters International
results.brief_description: Many people find public speaking to be a terrifying experience. However, this fear is a learned response. The underlying purpose of this film is to link public speaking to everyday interpersonal communication and to explain key communication factors.

results.title: Sparkling canals in Shaoshan
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio
results.brief_description: In 1958 the Chinese people of ShaoShan in Hunan Province, built a reservoir on the middle reaches of the Yangtze River for the irrigation of the fields. It was eventually abandoned through fear of the counter-revolution until 1965 when it was resurrected again to prevent droughts and/or floods over 2500 square kilometers. This film documents the rebuilding of the irrigation canals under the guidance of Chairman Mao and the manual labour of the Chinese peasants. ShaoShan is the birthplace of Chairman Mao.

results.title: Space invaders: sexual harassment at work (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Sexual harassment at work is today recognised as one of the most pressing of all issues facing management. This series of seven trigger films, (2 mins. each), is designed to help men and women in the workplace come to terms with sexual harassment and re-align their own attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: Somewhere in France: in search of the ANZACS
results.brief_description: Designed to help students become more aware of the history around them, this video and guide provides students with an excellent primary source kit of Australian experiences of the Great War; as told through the experiences of Australian soldiers.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of youth unemployment and how it affects job seekers. Uses a humorous approach to present the case of a young man who loses his job and the problems he faces when he tries to find another. Cast includes: David Bradley, Lachlin Miles, Dave Taggart, Pina Marino, Rossi Webb, Ingrid Buxton. Music: Milton Trot and Bill Menz.
